AD.name: bluetooh.discovery.devices
AD.description: Configurable property to set list of bluetooth enabled devices to be discovered

AD.name: bluetooth.discovery.mode
AD.description: Configurable property specifying the discovery mode among GIAC and LIAC

AD.name: bluetooth.ignore.unnamed.devices
AD.description: Configuration property enabling the support of unnamed devices. Unnamed devices do not communicate their name.

AD.name: bluetooth.discovery.unpairOnDeparture
AD.description: Configuration property enabling the unpairing of matching devices (filter given in the fleet description) when they are not reachable anymore

AD.name: bluetooth.discovery.onlinecheck
AD.description: This configuration property enables the online check when a device is found. It turns around the Windows 7 behavior, where the device discovery returns all paired devices even if they are not reachable anymore. However it introduces a performance cost ( a service discovery for each cached device on every discovery search). It should be used in combination with bluetooth.discovery.unpairOnDeparture

AD.name: bluetooth.discovery.period
AD.description: Configurable Property specifying the time between two inquiries. This time is specified in second, and should be carefully chosen. To many inquiries flood the network and block correct discovery. A too big period, makes the device dynamism hard to track.

AD.name: publish.appTopicPrefix
AD.description: Prefix of topic to publish/receive commands to start and stop
